title: Getting Started with ggguides
text: ggguides simplifies common legend operations ggplot2. Instead memorizing theme element names nested structure, can use intuitive one-liner functions position, style, manage legends. Key features: Position legends legend_left(), legend_right(), legend_top(), legend_bottom(), legend_inside() Style legends legend_style() fonts, backgrounds, borders Wrap legend entries legend_wrap() multi-column layouts Collect legends patchwork compositions collect_legends()

code: p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   labs(color = "Cylinders")  p

code: p + legend_left() p + legend_bottom()

text: Place legend inside plot area using coordinates shortcuts:
code: p + legend_inside(position = "topright") p + legend_inside(x = 0.02, y = 0.98, just = c("left", "top"))

code: p + legend_none()

title: Multiple Legends
text: plot maps multiple aesthetics (colour, size, shape, etc.), ggplot2 creates separate legends . ggguides provides functions control legends individually: Hide specific legends legend_hide() Keep certain legends legend_select() Control display order legend_order_guides() Force merge/split legend_merge() legend_split() Position legends separately using parameter position functions Style legends separately using parameter legend_style()

title: Multiple Legends
code: # Plot with multiple aesthetics p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt,                         color = factor(cyl),                         size = hp,                         shape = factor(am))) +   geom_point() +   labs(color = "Cylinders", size = "Horsepower", shape = "Transmission")  p

title: Multiple Legends
text: Use legend_hide() remove specific legends keeping others:
code: # Hide the size legend p + legend_hide(size) # Hide multiple legends p + legend_hide(size, shape)

title: Multiple Legends
text: Use legend_select() keep certain legends (inverse legend_hide()):
code: # Keep only the colour legend p + legend_select(colour) # Keep colour and shape p + legend_select(colour, shape)

title: Multiple Legends
text: default, legends appear unspecified order. Use legend_order_guides() control display order:
code: # Default order p # Size legend first, then colour, then shape p + legend_order_guides(size = 1, colour = 2, shape = 3)

title: Multiple Legends
text: ggplot2 automatically merges legends title matching labels. Use legend_merge() legend_split() override behavior.

title: Multiple Legends
code: # Plot where colour and fill map to the same variable p_merge <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl), fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(shape = 21, size = 4, stroke = 1.5) +   labs(color = "Cylinders", fill = "Cylinders")  # Legends merge automatically when titles and labels match p_merge # Explicitly request merge (reinforces default behavior) p_merge + legend_merge(colour, fill)

title: Multiple Legends
code: # Force separate legends even when they could merge p_merge + legend_split(colour, fill)

title: Multiple Legends
text: Position functions (legend_left(), legend_right(), legend_top(), legend_bottom()) accept parameter position specific legends:
code: # Place colour legend on the left, size legend at bottom p +   legend_hide(shape) +   legend_left(by = "colour") +   legend_bottom(by = "size") # Colour legend on top, size on right p +   legend_hide(shape) +   legend_top(by = "colour") +   legend_right(by = "size")

title: Multiple Legends
text: Use parameter legend_style() apply different styles different legends:
code: p +   legend_hide(shape) +   legend_style(title_face = "bold", background = "grey95", by = "colour") +   legend_style(size = 10, by = "size")

title: Multiple Legends
text: functions work together:
code: # Complex example: hide shape, position colour on left with bold title, # position size at bottom with smaller text p +   legend_hide(shape) +   legend_left(by = "colour") +   legend_style(title_face = "bold", title_size = 14, by = "colour") +   legend_bottom(by = "size") +   legend_style(size = 9, direction = "horizontal", by = "size")

title: Patchwork Integration
text: combining multiple plots patchwork, legends often need special handling: Duplicate legends - aesthetic mapped multiple plots creates redundancy Alignment issues - Legends may align properly across panels Spanning - Legends sometimes span multiple rows ggguides provides collect_legends() collect_axes() address challenges.

title: Patchwork Integration
code: library(patchwork)  p1 <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() + labs(title = "Plot 1", color = "Cylinders") p2 <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, hp, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() + labs(title = "Plot 2", color = "Cylinders")  # Default patchwork: duplicate legends p1 | p2

title: Patchwork Integration
text: Use collect_legends() gather legends plots composition:
code: collect_legends(p1 | p2)

title: Patchwork Integration
text: Control collected legend appears:
code: collect_legends(p1 | p2, position = "bottom") collect_legends(p1 | p2, position = "left")

title: Patchwork Integration
text: vertically stacked plots, legends can centered span full height. Using different plot heights makes spanning behavior visible.

title: Patchwork Integration
code: # Create plots with different heights using plot_layout p3 <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, disp, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() + labs(title = "Plot 3", color = "Cylinders")  # Stack with different heights: 1, 1/2, 1/4 stacked <- (p1 / p2 / p3) + plot_layout(heights = c(4, 2, 1)) collect_legends(stacked, position = "right")

title: Patchwork Integration
text: Use span = TRUE make legend fill full height:
code: gt <- collect_legends(stacked, position = "right", span = TRUE) grid::grid.draw(gt)

title: Patchwork Integration
text: Attach legend specific row(s) instead spanning :
code: # Legend attached to row 1 only (the tallest plot) gt <- collect_legends(stacked, position = "right", span = 1) grid::grid.draw(gt) # Legend attached to rows 1 and 2 gt <- collect_legends(stacked, position = "right", span = 1:2) grid::grid.draw(gt)

title: Patchwork Integration
text: stacking plots vertically, x-axis may duplicated. Use collect_axes() remove redundant axes:
code: # Plots stacked vertically - x-axis is duplicated p_top <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt)) +   geom_point() + labs(y = "Weight")  p_bottom <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, disp)) +   geom_point() + labs(y = "Displacement")  # Without axis collection (both have x-axis) p_top / p_bottom # With axis collection (removes redundant x-axis from top) collect_axes(p_top / p_bottom)

title: Patchwork Integration
text: ggguides functions work together:
code: p1_styled <- p1 + legend_style(size = 11, title_face = "bold") p2_styled <- p2 + legend_style(size = 11, title_face = "bold")  collect_legends(p1_styled | p2_styled, position = "right")

title: Patchwork Integration
text: Handle complex patchwork layouts:
code: p4 <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(qsec, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() + labs(title = "Plot 4", color = "Cylinders")  # 2x2 grid layout <- (p1 | p2) / (p3 | p4) collect_legends(layout, position = "right")

title: Legend Positioning
text: ggguides provides position helpers handle legend placement without requiring knowledge ggplot2’s theme system. function sets appropriate combination legend.position, legend.justification, legend.box.just achieve proper alignment.

title: Legend Positioning
code: p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   labs(color = "Cylinders")  p + legend_left() + ggtitle("Left") p + legend_right() + ggtitle("Right")

title: Legend Positioning
text: placing legends top bottom, legend automatically oriented horizontally:
code: p + legend_top() + ggtitle("Top") p + legend_bottom() + ggtitle("Bottom")

title: Legend Positioning
text: Use align_to parameter control legend aligns plot:
code: p_titled <- p + labs(title = "Fuel Economy by Weight")  # Default: align to panel p_titled + legend_top() + ggtitle("Panel alignment (default)")  # Align to full plot (useful with titles) p_titled + legend_top(align_to = "plot") + ggtitle("Plot alignment")

title: Legend Positioning
text: legend_inside() places legend within plot panel. can use either coordinate values named shortcuts.

code: p + legend_inside(position = "topright") + ggtitle("Top right") p + legend_inside(position = "bottomleft") + ggtitle("Bottom left")

text: precise control, specify x/y coordinates (0-1 scale) justification:
code: p + legend_inside(x = 0.95, y = 0.95, just = c("right", "top"))

title: Legend Positioning
text: Inside legends often need background readability:
code: p + legend_inside(   position = "topright",   background = "#FFF3E0",   border = "#FF9800" )

code: p + legend_horizontal() + ggtitle("Horizontal") p + legend_vertical() + ggtitle("Vertical")

title: Styling & Customization
text: ggguides provides styling functions customize legend appearance without diving ggplot2’s theme element hierarchy. main functions : legend_style() - Comprehensive styling (fonts, backgrounds, borders) legend_keys() - Override key appearance (size, alpha, shape) legend_order() - Reorder legend entries legend_wrap() - Multi-column/row layouts legend_reverse() - Reverse entry order colorbar_style() - Customize continuous color bar legends

title: Styling & Customization
text: Adjust overall text size (applies title labels):
code: p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   labs(color = "Cylinders")  p + ggtitle("Default size") p + legend_style(size = 14) + ggtitle("size = 14")

title: Styling & Customization
text: Change font family legend text:
code: p + legend_style(family = "serif") + ggtitle("serif") p + legend_style(family = "mono") + ggtitle("mono")

title: Styling & Customization
text: Make title stand separate size face settings:
code: p + legend_style(   size = 12,   title_size = 14,   title_face = "bold" )

title: Styling & Customization
text: legends long category names, rotate labels save space:

title: Styling & Customization
code: p_long <- ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +   geom_point()  p_long + legend_style(angle = 45)

title: Styling & Customization
text: Use 90 degrees fully vertical text. Key height automatically adjusted prevent label overlap:
code: p_long + legend_style(angle = 90)

title: Styling & Customization
text: Rotate legend title independently:
code: p_long + legend_style(title_angle = 90, title_hjust = 0.5) + ggtitle("Rotated title only") p_long + legend_style(angle = 45, title_angle = 90) + ggtitle("Both rotated")

title: Styling & Customization
text: Add visual containers around legend:
code: p + legend_style(   background = "#FFF3E0" ) p + legend_style(   background = "#FFF3E0",   background_color = "#FF9800" )

title: Styling & Customization
text: Adjust size legend keys (color swatches):
code: p + legend_style(   key_width = 1.5,   key_height = 1.5 )

title: Styling & Customization
text: Control spacing around legend:
code: p + legend_style(   background = "#FFF3E0",   margin = 0.5 )

title: Styling & Customization
text: Combine styling options:
code: p + legend_style(   size = 11,   title_size = 13,   title_face = "bold",   family = "sans",   key_width = 1.2,   background = "#FFF3E0",   background_color = "#FF9800",   margin = 0.3 )

title: Styling & Customization
text: legends many entries, legend_wrap() creates multi-column multi-row layouts.

title: Styling & Customization
code: ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +   geom_point() +   legend_wrap(ncol = 2)

title: Styling & Customization
code: ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +   geom_point() +   legend_wrap(nrow = 2)

code: ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +   geom_point() +   legend_wrap(nrow = 2) +   legend_bottom()

title: Styling & Customization
text: plot aesthetics like small point sizes low alpha values make legend keys hard read, legend_keys() overrides key appearance without affecting plot.

title: Styling & Customization
code: p_small <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 1) +   labs(color = "Cylinders")  p_small + ggtitle("Small points in legend") p_small + legend_keys(size = 4) + ggtitle("Enlarged legend keys")

title: Styling & Customization
code: p_alpha <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.3, size = 3) +   labs(color = "Cylinders")  p_alpha + ggtitle("Transparent legend keys") p_alpha + legend_keys(alpha = 1) + ggtitle("Opaque legend keys")

title: Styling & Customization
code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.3, size = 1) +   legend_keys(size = 4, alpha = 1)

title: Styling & Customization
text: default, legend_keys() applies colour fill legends. Target specific aesthetics aesthetic parameter:
code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), mpg, fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_boxplot(alpha = 0.5) +   legend_keys(alpha = 1, aesthetic = "fill")

title: Styling & Customization
text: Use named shapes clarity instead numeric codes:  Available shape names include: "circle", "square", "diamond", "triangle", "plus", "cross", "asterisk".
code: p + legend_keys(shape = "square") + ggtitle("Square") p + legend_keys(shape = "diamond") + ggtitle("Diamond")

title: Styling & Customization
text: Shapes 21-25 (names ending _filled) support outline fill colors, making legends visible background:  Shape types:
code: # White fill with colored outline p + legend_keys(shape = "circle_filled", fill = "white", stroke = 1.5) +   ggtitle("White fill, colored outline")  # Colored fill with black outline p + legend_keys(shape = "square_filled", colour = "black", stroke = 1) +   ggtitle("Colored fill, black outline")

title: Styling & Customization
text: legend_order() changes order legend entries without modifying factor levels data.

title: Styling & Customization
text: Specify exact order want:
code: p + legend_order(c("8", "6", "4"))

title: Styling & Customization
text: Apply functions like rev sort current order:
code: p + legend_order(rev) + ggtitle("Reversed") p + legend_order(sort) + ggtitle("Sorted")

title: Styling & Customization
text: Reorder legends fill, shape, aesthetics:
code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_bar() +   legend_order(c("8", "4", "6"), aesthetic = "fill")

title: Styling & Customization
text: simple reversal, legend_reverse() convenient shorthand:
code: p + legend_reverse()

title: Styling & Customization
text: ggguides functions compose +:
code: ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +   geom_point() +   legend_left() +   legend_style(     size = 11,     title_face = "bold",     background = "#FFF3E0"   ) ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +   geom_point() +   legend_wrap(ncol = 2) +   legend_bottom() +   legend_style(size = 10, title_face = "bold")

text: continuous scales, colorbar_style() customizes color bar appearance.

title: Styling & Customization
code: p_cont <- ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_tile()  p_cont

title: Styling & Customization
text: Create taller, thinner bars:
code: p_cont + colorbar_style(width = 0.5, height = 10, aesthetic = "fill")

title: Styling & Customization

code: p_cont + colorbar_style(width = 10, height = 0.5, direction = "horizontal", aesthetic = "fill") +   legend_bottom() p_cont + colorbar_style(frame = TRUE, aesthetic = "fill") + ggtitle("Black frame") p_cont + colorbar_style(frame = "#FF9800", aesthetic = "fill") + ggtitle("Orange frame")

code: p_cont + colorbar_style(ticks = FALSE, frame = "#FF9800", aesthetic = "fill")
